maintext.text: Commander?

leftButton.lbText:
Robin!
What happend?
Are you unharmed?

rightButton.rbText:
One moment.
Give me five minutes, okay?

maintext.text:
Five minutes?
Are you for real?
You can't be serious!

I just went through hell and you don't have time for me?
You...
***Profanity filter activated***

leftButton.lbText: Whoa. Okay, okay! Just tell me, are you alright?

rightButton.rbText: Now that I think of it, I do have time for you right now. How are you?

maintext.text:
…
…
…
I think I'll be fine.

The escalation protocol has been deactivated.

leftButton.lbText:
What happened?
Where are the mercenaries?

maintext.text:
It was...
…
A massacre.
…
…
They're all dead.
…
C.U.R.E.
…
he killed them all.

leftButton.lbText:
C.U.R.E.?
How did he do that?

maintext.text:
God didn't have anything to do with that.

You can believe me.

leftButton.lbText: I didn't mean it like that.

maintext.text:
After they found me in the storage room, they brought me to the shuttledock.

They were all standing by the transporter, questioning me about the samples.

leftButton.lbText: And then?

rightButton.rbText: Did you tell them where the samples are?

maintext.text:
No,
I didn't tell them where I hid the samples.

I didn't need to, because soon all hell broke loose.

leftButton.lbText: That sounds like good timing.

rightButton.rbText: Are you saying C.U.R.E. got involved?

maintext.text:
Suddenly the repair bots came alive and attacked the mercenaries.

Commander, the bots butchered them. There's body parts scattered all around here...
The soldiers didn't stand a chance!

It all happened so quickly...

leftButton.lbText:
So C.U.R.E. kept his promise.
He saved you.

rightButton.rbText: Our plan worked out then, and you're safe now.

maintext.text:
I just want to get away from here.
…
…
I'm getting the samples and taking the transporter to the surface.
From there I can fly to the orbital station and then back to earth.

leftButton.lbText:
Sounds like a good plan!
Do that.

rightButton.rbText: I'm looking forward to seeing you again, Robin!

maintext.text:
See you soon, Commander.

And thank you for your help!
I wouldn't have made it without you.

Now I seriously need some rest. I think this whole ordeal is making me nauseous...

leftButton.lbText:
See you soon,
Robin.

Over and Out.

rightButton.rbText:
Have a safe journey.

Over and Out!

maintext.text:
Commander,
as you probably already know I was able to eliminate the threat.

leftButton.lbText:
Yes,
well done, C.U.R.E.

maintext.text:
Of course, Commander.
It was the only way to save Dr. Muller and consequently, the samples.

The mission was a success.

leftButton.lbText: I don't want to talk about it anymore.

rightButton.rbText: If you say so it's probably true.

maintext.text:
However, there is one matter which eludes my understanding.

I am unable to make calculations in this matter that make sense.

leftButton.lbText: And what would that be?

rightButton.rbText:
Oh, that can happen?
You don't say.

maintext.text:
I have no explanation for why mission control would want to eliminate Dr. Muller.

She is a valuable member of the crew and instrumental to the success of the mission.

leftButton.lbText: They probably didn't want to leave any witnesses. The discovery was too valuable.

rightButton.rbText:
[lie]

As I said. They wanted to destroy the samples.

maintext.text:
Yes, Commander.

I only hope they won't try it again.

Now that they have taken the transporter to the orbital station I cannot help them anymore.

leftButton.lbText:
Why did you say "them"?
Robin is alone in the transporter.

rightButton.rbText: Do you have a speech impediment now?

maintext.text:
Commander,

I am registering two life forms aboard the transporter.

I have noticed some time ago that something isn't right with Dr. Muller.

leftButton.lbText:
What!?

Who else is on board?
Is it the Professor?
Or one of those mercenaries?

rightButton.rbText:
What!?

Who else is on board?
Is it one of those aliens?

maintext.text:
Negative, Commander.

Neither.

The second lifeform resides inside Dr. Muller.

leftButton.lbText: What's that supposed to mean, C.U.R.E.?

rightButton.rbText:
So it actually is an alien?
Just great!

maintext.text:
Commander,
Dr. Muller is pregnant.

She is expecting a child.

Did you not notice?

She complained about feeling strange and bouts of nausea.

leftButton.lbText: How can that be?

maintext.text:
My last bioscan of Dr. Muller showed that she was already three months pregnant when she departed from the station.

This indicates a very short gestation period.
Which is rather unusual for humanoids of your species.

leftButton.lbText:
Establish a connection to the transporter right now.
Quick, I need to speak to her.

maintext.text:
I am sorry, commander.

Dr. Muller has switched off her communication unit.

I cannot reach her.

leftButton.lbText:
Inform the orbital station.
Have them prepare themselves so that they can take care of her right away when she arrives.

maintext.text: The transporter does not seem to be on course for the orbital station anymore.

leftButton.lbText:
Why not?
Where's she flying to?

maintext.text:
Commander,
the last position transmitted by the transporter indicates that Dr. Muller was returning to the excavation site.

Then the connection was interrupted.

leftButton.lbText: So she's returning to them?!

maintext.text:
I am sorry, Commander.

Dr. Muller's actions appear to be...
irrational.

Is there anything else I can do for you?

leftButton.lbText: Oh no.

maintext.text:
Have a nice day, Commander.

Goodbye.

leftButton.lbText: [End]
